profile_positions.description:
- Provision of legal advice relating to operations on medico-legal issues and questions of public international law, international humanitarian law, international human rights law, refugee law and other areas
- Contributing to MSF legal analysis and advocacy with regard to the respect of patients and populations in need and the safeguard of international humanitarian space, law and principles in the context of MSF operations
- Providing country operations with political and contextual analysis on factors shaping the humanitarian landscape and issues MSF wants to leverage or influence
- Working with operational teams in identifying and documenting protection issues affecting the populations MSF serves, and defining MSF’s strategies to address them
- Driving consistent implementation of advocacy strategies
- Acting as a ‘sparring partner’ to the Heads of Mission and Operational Managers on protection issues, humanitarian principles and organizational positioning
- Advising country teams on the process of the gathering, analysis and synthesis of information/data
- Drafting of position papers, briefing documents, and public reports
- Identifying and developing key humanitarian themes for MSF, conducting research, writing papers, organising internal and external discussions
- Developing and delivering training modules for country teams and headquarters staff on humanitarian affairs and legal frameworks
profile_positions.title: Humanitarian Affairs Advisor/Legal Specialist

profile_positions.description:
-	Undertake extensive legal research and analysis, handle a wide range of multidisciplinary complex legal matters including interpretation and application of various legal instruments to facilitate comprehensive legal services
-	Review legal documents, identify important issues, similarities and inconsistencies, and present findings for internal review
-	Prepare or assist in preparation of legal opinions/advice on a wide range of legal issues, background papers, studies, memoranda, reports and other legal documents
-	Draft, review and negotiate agreements and contracts with public and private entities, including participation in negotiation and settlement of claims and disputes
-	Identify potential liabilities, particularly vis-à-vis third parties, and assist in the management of risks in WFP’s activities
-	Prepare and assess briefs of evidence and draw recommendations to facilitate legal analysis and solutions
-	Servicing committees, task forces, expert working groups and other bodies with legal advice and preparation or review of legal documents to facilitate the formulation of WFP’s position
profile_positions.title: Legal Consultant

company.name: Organisation for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons (OPCW)

profile_positions.company: Organisation for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons (OPCW)
profile_positions.description:
-	Coordination of all preparatory procedural and substantive actions relating to meetings of the OPCW’s governing bodies (e.g., ongoing analysis, research, consultation, preparation of documents)
-	Provision of policy, procedural, legal advice and background information to the Chairpersons of the OPCW’s governing bodies, during informal consultations and in response to requests from national delegations and the OPCW Technical Secretariat
-	Preparation of documents relating to the work of the OPCW’s governing bodies (e.g., agendas for meetings of the OPCW’s governing bodies, the Chairpersons’ statements to the OPCW’s governing bodies, internal and external correspondence, minutes of meetings, and documents considered by the OPCW’s governing bodies)
-	Preparation of analytical summary of the outcome of meetings of the OPCW’s governing bodies and ensuring timely follow-up thereto
-	Conduct of research into precedents and maintaining a record of precedents relating to the functioning and work of the OPCW’s governing bodies and other background information
-	Preparation of meetings of the Bureau of the Executive Council, the General Committee of the Conference of the States Parties and any other meetings or consultations pertaining to the activities of the OPCW’s governing bodies
profile_positions.title: Policy, Procedure and Legal Coordination Consultant

company.name: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (MINUSMA)

profile_positions.company: United Nations Multidimensional Integrated Stabilization Mission in Mali (MINUSMA)
profile_positions.description:
-	Voting member of the Project Appraisal Committee reviewing and recommending reinsertion and community violence reduction projects to the Head of the Mission for MINUSMA funding
-	Legal review of reports of Boards of Inquiry, Head of Mission reports and terms of reference of Boards of Inquiry
-	Review, interpretation and drafting of agreements
-	Assistance with handling cases relating to the detention of individuals by MINUSMA
-	Provision of advice relating to the Privileges and Immunities of MINUSMA and its members
-	Handling and provision of legal advice relating to claims submitted by third parties
-	Legal review, interpretation and enhancement of internal legislation
-	Review and redaction of strictly confidential documents shared with national judicial authorities
-	Delivery of presentations on the Legal Affairs Office at induction trainings organized by MINUSMA
profile_positions.title: Legal Affairs Officer

profile_positions.description:
- Privileges and Immunities of International Organizations
- Intellectual Property
- Member of litigation team handling an arbitration on a personnel-related matter
profile_positions.title: Legal Officer

profile_positions.description:
- Preparation of legal opinions and provision of legal advice on the interpretation and implementation of WFP’s General Regulations and Rules, Financial Regulations and Rules, decisions of the Executive Board, the 1946 Convention on the Privileges and Immunities of the United Nations, the 1947 Convention on the Privileges and Immunities of the Specialised Agencies and other legal documents
- Provision of legal advice on the Privileges and Immunities (P&I) of WFP, including defending and
asserting WFP’s P&I vis-à-vis claims brought by third parties against WFP before national courts, liaising with local legal counsels, reviewing submissions to national courts prepared by local legal counsels and provision of guidance (also in Arabic), drafting communications to Ministries of Foreign Affairs asserting WFP’s P&I
- Provision of legal advice and assistance in negotiating, reviewing and drafting documents related to Basic Agreements, Contribution Agreements, Grant Agreements, Framework Cooperation Agreements, Memoranda of Understanding, Collaboration Agreements, Lease Agreements, Land Agreements, concluded with NGOs, other United Nations Agencies, International Organisations and the European Commission (in English&French)
- Lead attorney dealing with all legal aspects relating to the project “ARC Replica”, whose ultimate aim was the signature by WFP of the first climate risk insurance policy replicating insurance policies undertaken by member countries
- Assistance with the revision and drafting of WFP’s General Regulations and Rules
profile_positions.title: Legal Officer (Consultant)

company.name: Organisation for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons (OPCW)

profile_positions.company: Organisation for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons (OPCW)
profile_positions.description:
-	Preparation of legal opinions on the interpretation and implementation of the Chemical Weapons Convention, decisions of the policy making organs and other legal documents
-	Preparation of legal opinions on the interpretation and implementation of the Chemical Weapons Convention, decisions of the policy making organs and other legal documents related to the elimination of the Syrian chemical weapons programme and the removal of the remaining Libyan chemical weapons
-	Provision of legal advice and assistance in negotiating and drafting documents related to Voluntary Contributions Agreements provided to the Trust Funds for Syria and Libya and other Trust Funds (conduct of negotiations in English and French)
-	Preparation of legal opinions, memoranda, legal documents, legal notes, decisions of the policy-making organs, procurement documents, non-papers, country backgrounders, letters, emails on any issue
-	Drafting, review and negotiation of commercial contracts (including contracts relating to the implementation of the Enterprise Resource Planning project), and international agreements with States Parties, the Host State, other international organisations and other entities
-	Focal point on issues relating to Privileges and Immunities Agreements
-	Drafting and review of staff and financial rules and regulations and other pieces of internal legislation
-	Assistance with the handling of personnel matters and the preparation of briefs submitted to the Appeals Council/ILOAT
-	Member of team representing the OPCW in meetings with other international organisations, the Municipality of The Hague, The Hague Police on the designing and implementation of a shared security information platform; and assistance with the identification, negotiation and drafting of necessary legal instruments, and with the provision of legal advice on issues of personal data protection
-	Delivery of presentations to several audiences
-	Assistance with the recruitment and supervision of interns
profile_positions.title: Associate Legal Officer (Consultant)

profile_positions.company: Organisation for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons (OPCW)
profile_positions.description:
- Assistance in drafting legal opinions on the interpretation and implementation of the Chemical Weapons Convention (CWC), decisions of the policy-making organs and other legal documents
- Assistance in drafting legal opinions on the interpretation and implementation of the CWC, decisions of the policy-making organs and other legal documents related to the elimination of the Syrian chemical weapons programme
- Provision of legal advice and assistance in negotiating and drafting documents related to Voluntary Contributions Agreements provided to the Trust Funds for the Destruction of Syrian Chemical Weapons
- Drafting of memoranda, legal documents, legal notes, decisions of the policy-making organs, procurement documents, non-papers, country backgrounders, letters, emails on any legal issue
- Legal review and drafting of international agreements, contracts, insurance policies, staff and financial rules and regulations, internal legislation and any other document as needed
- Development of Model Technical Agreement for trainings conducted by the Organisation
- Focal point on issues relating to Privileges and Immunities Agreements
- Assistance with the preparation of briefs submitted to the Appeals Council/ILOAT
- Main editor and reviser of one of the OPCW Publications, “OPCW: The Legal Texts, 3rd Edition”; assistance with the management of all aspects of the project; acting as a focal point for the publisher
- Assistance with the management of the project on digitisation of materials on travaux préparatoires of the CWC; acting as a focal point for the vendor
- Assistance with the development, implementation and deployment of a new workflow/document management system for the Office of the Legal Adviser; provision of training to all users of the system; acting as first line of technical support; management of the platform
- Assistance with the recruitment and supervision of interns
profile_positions.title: Assistant Legal Officer (Consultant)

profile_positions.company: Organisation for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons (OPCW)
profile_positions.description:
- Legal research on issues of General Public International Law, International Administrative Law, Privileges and Immunities, Procurement and any other field as needed
- Drafting of memoranda, legal documents, legal notes, decisions of the policy-making organs, country backgrounders, letters, emails
- Assistance with the legal review of internal documents, international agreements, contracts, insurance policies, internal legislation and any other document as needed
- Member of negotiating team of a Privileges and Immunities Agreement
- Assistance with the finalization of the Contracts with companies on Services for the Transport, Treatment and Disposal of Hazardous and Non-Hazardous Organic and Inorganic Chemicals, Effluents and Related Materials within the context of the Plan for the Destruction of Syrian Chemical Weapons
- Editing and compilation of materials for OPCW publications
- Assistance with the preparation of files on legal issues
- Assistance with the preparation of briefs submitted to the Appeals Council or the Administrative Tribunal of the International Labour Organisation 
- Proofreading
- Archiving of files
- Handling of highly confidential information

- Teaching English irrespective of the level and the age of the students
- Teaching applying interactive methods and using technological means and projection devices
- Training of colleagues on the use of technological means for educational purposes
profile_positions.title: English Teacher

profile_positions.description:
-	Conduct of non-formal educational activities aiming at the promotion of respect and understanding of human rights and combating stereotypes among students of all ages
-	Research on Human Rights issues (human trafficking, discrimination, rights of the child etc)
-	Contribution to the creation of the Teachers’ Manual “Non-formal education against discrimination for primary school children” by providing results from my conducting lessons based on the activities drawn from Council of Europe’s COMPASITO-Manual on Human Rights Education for Children
-	Contribution to research for material concerning the part “Activities: Education and Human Rights” of the official website of the Center and to designing this specific part of the website
-	Translation from Greek to Arabic of the brochure “We say NO to discrimination at school “within the framework of IRIS Project: Combating Stereotypes and Discrimination
-	Translation of specific activities drawn from the COMPASITO-Manual on Human Rights Education for Children from English to Greek indispensable for the draft of the Teachers’ Manual “Non-formal education against discrimination for primary school children”
profile_positions.title: Human Rights Intern
